availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert L. McCook (Cincinnati, Ohio, attorney and brigadier general )

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, attorney and brigadier general. Ohio native. Studied law in Carrolton, Ohio at the office of Judge E.R. Eckley. Studied law at the practice of Edwin M. Stanton and George W. McCook in Steubenville, Ohio c.1840s. Attorney in Hardin County, Illinois in 1850. Partner with Judge Johann Bernhard Stallo in law firm in Cincinnati, Ohio c.1850s. Served in the Ninth Ohio Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as colonel from May 27, 1861 to April 4, 1862. Promoted to brigadier general of volunteers on April 4, 1862. Died in New Market, Madison County, Alabama on August 6, 1862 from wounds sustained in combat.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Hardin County, p. 50.
Find A Grave, "Robert Latimer McCook (December 28, 1827-August 6, 1862)," Memorial #4647, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/4647 (accessed May 24, 2019).
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1866, vol. 1 (Akron: The Werner Company, 1893), 179.
Wayne Fanebust, Brigadier General Robert L. McCook and Colonel Daniel McCook, Jr., A Union Dual Biography (Jefferson, NC: McFarland & Company, Inc., Publishers, 2017), 11, 20-22.
